Location: HYBRID HEARING - Council Chambers - City Hall
Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Governmental Operations and the Committee on Technology

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Governmental Operations and the Committee on Technology
Oversight - Ensuring Equal Access to 311 – Reviewing the Experience of Limited-English Proficient New Yorkers and NYCHA Residents.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Ensuring Equal Access to 311 – Reviewing the Experience of Limited-English Proficient New Yorkers and NYCHA Residents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a separate 311 category for COVID-19 testing site complaints
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Creation of a separate 311 category for COVID-19 testing site complaints.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the number of steps to submit service requests or complaints on the 311 website and mobile application
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Number of steps to submit service requests or complaints on the 311 website and mobile application.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the commissioner of information technology and telecommunications to report on wait times for the 311 customer service center to connect callers to an interpreter
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of information technology and telecommunications to report on wait times for the 311 customer service center to connect callers to an interpreter.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the department of information technology and telecommunications updating 311 complaint types and reporting on such updates
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: DOITT updating 311 complaint types and reporting on such updates.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the identification of languages spoken by callers to the 311 customer service center
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Identification of languages spoken by callers to the 311 customer service center.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and U.S. Department of Housing & Urban Development to take strong action and increase NYCHA accountability by auditing the responsiveness of NYCHA managers to tenants.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Increase NYCHA accountability by auditing the responsiveness of NYCHA managers to tenants.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Menin, Paladino, Ung, Lee, Schulman, Gutiérrez, Hanif, Abreu, Bottcher, Holden and Brewer

Items.Title: Oversight - Ensuring Equal Access to 311 – Reviewing the Experience of Limited-English Proficient New Yorkers and NYCHA Residents.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Ensuring Equal Access to 311 – Reviewing the Experience of Limited-English Proficient New Yorkers and NYCHA Residents.
